critique: This is an executive order from 1948 directing the Secretary of the Army to take control of the nation's railroads due to labor disputes. It aims to ensure uninterrupted transportation service. The order emphasizes maintaining existing management and labor conditions, and adherence to existing laws. It seems to expand executive power in response to an emergency, but also respects existing legal frameworks and labor rights. It has a moderate intervention in the economy to resolve the labor dispute.
